text: The Federal Reserve announced a 0.25% interest rate hike to combat inflation, marking the third increase this year.
Stock markets rallied after strong quarterly earnings reports from major tech companies exceeded analyst expectations.
The unemployment rate dropped to 3.5%, the lowest level in over a decade, signaling a robust job market.
Scientists discovered a new species of deep-sea fish that produces its own light through bioluminescence.
The James Webb Space Telescope captured unprecedented images of distant galaxies forming in the early universe.
Researchers developed a new biodegradable plastic made from seaweed that decomposes in just 4 weeks.
The underdog team secured a dramatic victory in the championship final with a last-minute goal.
The star quarterback announced his retirement after 15 seasons and three Super Bowl victories.
The Olympic committee announced new sports will be added to the next Summer Games program.
The latest smartphone release features an AI-powered camera system that automatically enhances photos.
A major software company announced a new operating system with improved security and privacy features.
Electric vehicle sales surpassed traditional car sales for the first time in several European countries.
The city council approved a new park development project in the downtown area.
Local volunteers organized a community cleanup event for the upcoming weekend.
